turns.speaker: TALIA
turns.text: You look a like you could use a friend.  You know, I'll never forget my first day at camp. Boy, I was so nervous that I...

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Hey--whaddya say, we need another muskrat to join our Sunshine circle. Scurry up!  Isn't Fun great!

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Well, the first week of camp has swhooshed on by and I thought this a perfect time to finally pow-wow. I think we should discuss--

turns.speaker: TALIA
turns.text: We need more ritalin. Can't we just grind it into the munchkins' food?

turns.speaker: TALIA
turns.text: Who wants to go tell the Anti-christ to take a "time-out?"

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Talia, just because you happen to be Jewish, doesn't mean you can make fun of someone desecrating the Lord's body...

turns.speaker: TALIA
turns.text: Yes, it does.

turns.speaker: TALIA
turns.text: Man asswipe, you made my enormous cock fall off...

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: I don't know about you dickweeds, but I gotta go take a nice, long juicy dump.

turns.speaker: TALIA
turns.text: College was entertaining, Wichita, but after 40 days and 40 nights of this, I really think we're going to get to know each...

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: Ooh look, time to confiscate my first water balloon...

turns.speaker: TALIA
turns.text: ...and it hurts too much to keep these feelings inside me any longer...

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: Talia, you know how important our friendship is to me and I would never do anything to...

turns.speaker: TALIA
turns.text: "...how important our friendship..." Not that old--Oh God, what have I done?

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: Talia, you're a wonderful person...

turns.speaker: TALIA
turns.text: Stop, stop, what was I thinking...out in the wilderness.  Under the stars. I've ruined every--

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: I just never thought of you in that...

turns.speaker: TALIA
turns.text: I gotta...I gotta go do a "bunk check." Or some fucking thing.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: I have to get up. Still more to do. That boy hates Asian people. That girl thinks she gave her Mom cancer by dropping a plate on her hand. Her daddy touches her. His daddy never touches him. It would have been cooler if I'd died.

turns.speaker: WICHITA                                            ]
turns.text: Wendy, I'll come back later.                                ] ] WENDY                                              ] Why does every ten year old know                            ] what they want to be when they grow                         ] up, but then as you actually grow                           ] up, you forget every--The girls are                         ] big on "Veterinarian" this year--                           ] I think it could be the "ballerina"                         ] of this century.                                            ]

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Isn't this the time where one of us says something deeply offensive to the other one...We're just so different.

turns.speaker: WICHITA                                            ]
turns.text: So what?                                                    ]

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Yeah, why should we let our actual personalities get in the way of us falling in love?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Yes!  God yes!  I would tell her that I love her!  To not let anyone take away her dreams..!

turns.speaker: WICHITA                                            ]
turns.text: You should grab her and shake her                           ] and tell her it's a goddamn war out                         ] there.  Idiots and assholes and                             ] sadists that must be defeated. Tell                         ] them her the truth!                                         ] ] WENDY                                              ] The truth is a lie!  Yes, television                        ] is rotting our brains!  Yes, people                         ] kill people easier than ever!  Does                         ] that mean we give up!  I think every                        ] child is capable of being talented,                         ] happy, and great. I'm probably wrong,                       ] but you know something, it's good                           ] to be wrong.                                                ] ] WICHITA                                            ]                                     ] You might be right...Wendy, you're                          ] fantastic. I can't stop adoring                             ] you...                                                      ]                                         ] What I thought was lust, was only                           ] love...You think I'm scared, scared                         ] of love...Love conquers all...Maybe                         ] I don't want to be conquered. "Share                        ] my life"--I barely got enough for                           ] myself...But we were in the picture                         ] together...the picture....                                  ] ] WENDY                                              ] What are you talking about?  What                           ] picture...                                                  ] ] WICHITA Just forget--You didn't bring me out here to help me change. You brought me out here to punish me.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Nobody really changes at summer camp. They merely find out who they are and become it more than ever.  You can't be helped, Wichita. I'm not sure you can be punished, either. But let's find out...

turns.speaker: WICHITA                                            ]
turns.text: How do you mean?                                            ]

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: What in the hell did you do that for?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: I-unno...Don't worry, I had everything on the hand memorized.

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: That's not what I was worried about.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Hey.

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: Hey--that coffee?  You're a goddess. Gimme, gimme...So what you gals talk about?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Oh you know, Bosnia, the importance of the right to vote...

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: Yeah, we talked about sex, too. Oberon must be sweating in his sleep.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: We had fun. I even got along with Talia-- for about three minutes. I don't know why she hates me so much...

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: Yes you do.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Yeah. I guess I do.

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: Talia's a rock. She'll be fine...

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Ann Taylor would have paid a lot more, but I wouldn't trade this experience for the world. Sometimes the first time you understand anything is when you have to explain it to someone younger-- You think I'm a big dork don't you?

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: I think your passion is terrific.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: I think your condescension is even better.

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: We have more in common than you think, Wendy dear. I loved summer camp when I was young and I love it now. It's important. Between school, family, friends, pot, playstations, basic cable, and the goddamn Internet, it's possible to go your whole life without listening to your soul. Out here, in nature, away from the shit, surrounded by reminders of who I once was...I get recharged. Now who's the dork?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Gosh, this is really a great conversation--I can't believe I said that out loud.

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: You know, this reminds me of the time we were talking about something and then just started kissing...

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Do you really not believe in God?

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: It's okay, there's a lot of things I don't believe in...

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: What else don't you believe in?

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: Talking while kissing.

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: So this is it, anybody you don't agree about everything with can't be your friend...

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Iunno.

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: "Iunno." I'm really beginning to hate that word of yours. I'm sorry for sounding hostile, but I'm not sorry for...

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Don't be. Don't be sorry for your thoughts. They make me...react. I don't know...all I know is that I can't go through another summer where I <u>almost</u> did something.

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: When were you in Niagara Falls?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: About ten years a--why...Don't look at these...Come on...Stop.

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: Todd was out there blocking the                             ] entrance. You would have been proud                         ] of me...My suit of armor is starting to come off. Not all of it, but enough to walk around...

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: And you'll be happy to know I'm going to drop my Snow White and the Seventy Dwarves act...Not all of it, but...

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: I was thinking...if we could mesh my way of thinking with your way                            ] of thinking, we could really do some                        ] great counseling. It's all about                            ] the evolution of the species, we                            ] can improve...                                              ]

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: I love you. Don't say I love you, too. I hate that--"love you, too."

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: I know what you mean. But it doesn't put me in too great a position...

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Don't worry, you...

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Fuck off.

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: I should leave. You probably need your rest.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Probably.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Are you allowed to do it more than once a night?

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: It's been known to happen.

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: Excuse me, Counselor Wendy, I need assistance in finding that important...thingie in the storage room.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Oh my gosh, why didn't you say something earlier...

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Do you really think we're fooling anyone?

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: Do you really think I care?

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: She got a little poison oak and started screaming for assisted suicide.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Be nice. Her father died in that TWA flight the government shot down...You know I'm going to be in the city next week. My mom says it's okay that I stay overnight at your dorm...It'll be nice to see you in                          ] a different shirt.                                          ] ] WICHITA                                            ] Oh, I didn't tell you. I wear this                          ] all year round. The chicks dig it...                        ]

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Excuse me, Wichita, I can't seem to reach the top shelf in the storage room. Could you...

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: Not now, Wendy.

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: This isn't about "doing it." I just think we need to talk some things out privately before...

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Ah, our last night at camp...I always knew it would be something special.

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: What do you want me to say?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Something more interesting than that...How could you?  How could--!

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: Stop!  Stop it, this afternoon was not what you thought...I overheard you and Pixel, at the side of the mess hall, your idea about the "test"...Do you believe me?

turns.speaker: WENDY
turns.text: Iunno.  Of course I believe you. It's so you...I didn't think it was possible                        ] for you to make me feel worse,                              ] but...you're saying you <u>deliberately</u>                        ] destroyed us!  I don't even get I'm-                        ] sorry-it-was-the-heat-of-the-                               ] moment...                                                   ] ] WICHITA                                            ] I know, I'm...I'm evil.                                     ] ] WENDY                                              ] Oh that's right, baby, you're so                            ] "evil." You're, you're so "dark"...                         ] ] WICHITA                                            ] We should get back.                                         ] ] WENDY                                              ] You're not evil or dark...you're                            ] just scared.                                                ]

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: Shut the fuck--!

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: Next to "boring," "Sucks" is the most painfully overused word in the current English language. I thought if I could reverse the meaning of "sucks" so it means something positive, I don't know...It would be vaguely revolutionary. It's kind of my social experiment for the summer. "Suck" is historically a nice word-- sno-cones, your mother's...

turns.speaker: WENDY                                              ]
turns.text: ] So <u>that's</u> one of the pearls from                            ] your mysterious journal?  And all this                      ] time I thought you were restructuring                       ] the world's economy.                                        ]

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: God, you're beautiful.

turns.speaker: WENDY                                              ]
turns.text: Thank you, my love.                                         ]

turns.speaker: WENDY                                              ]
turns.text: I'm still on anti-biotics, I really                         ] shouldn't be caffeining...Gosh, I've had a lot of daydreams about losing my virginity. Never one like this. For one, I wasn't a mutant. Secondly, I...What are you thinking?

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: I'm just thinking I'm glad I broke up with everyone I ever went out with.  The swelling is gonna go down, right?

turns.speaker: WENDY                                              ]
turns.text: Have you ever thought of instead                            ] of making children more equipped                            ] for reality, we should make reality                         ] more equipped for children?                                 ]

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: No. Fuck no. If you met yourself as a child, would you hug her and say everything's going to be okay...

turns.speaker: WENDY                                              ]
turns.text: Two billion years of evolution and                          ] you're what we've come up with--                            ] "Wichita"--the hot, cool, tell-it-                          ] like-it-is counselor with a dark                            ] side.                                                       ]

turns.speaker: WICHITA
turns.text: What are you doing, Wendy?  What's in that cup?

turns.speaker: WENDY                                              ]
turns.text: "Wichita"--The guy every boy wants                          ] to be and every girl wants to hold.                         ] You're the love of my life and the                          ] end of the world. Cheers.                                   ]

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Sorry Veronica.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Betty Finn. Gosh.....

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: I'm really sorry I couldn't make it to your birthday party last month.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: That's okay. Your Mom said you had a big date. Heck, I'd probably skip my own birthday party for a date.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Don't say that.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Oh Ronnie, you have to look at what I dug up the other day.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I don't believe it. I'm winning.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Don't get cocky, girl.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: I missed you. I know I'm not as, as exciting as your other friends.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: That's bullshit. Just shoot.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Ronnie, I'm still a virgin.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Shoot.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Betty, your daydreams are a lot better than my realities, believe me. I'm afraid though it's time to get your butt kicked.

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Ronnie!

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Hey, you're not settling for the two shots are you? Knock me out girl. It's the only way.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: It's not my style, okay?

turns.speaker: BETTY
turns.text: Nice guys finish last. I should know.

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: So, are you a cheerleader?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: No, not at all. BRAD You're pretty enough to be one.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Gee, thanks.

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: It's so great to be able to talk to a girl and not have to ask "What's your major?" I hate that.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Ever since Phil Collins did that MTV anti-drug commercial I refuse everything.

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: Phil Collins? Are you sure he isn't drinking and driving?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Jeez, right, then why don't I do drugs?

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: Hey, don't run away now.

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: How's my little cheerleader? Now I know everyone at your high school isn't so uptight, come <u>on</u>.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Hey really, I don't feel so great.

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: Let's do it on the coats. It'll be excellent.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: I have a little prepared speech I give when my suitor wants more than I'd like to give him.... Gee Blank, I had a nice....

turns.speaker: BRAD
turns.text: Save the speeches for Malcom X. I just wanna get laid.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: You don't deserve my fucking speech!

turns.speaker: COURTNEY
turns.text: If I got that money, I'd give it all to the poor. Every cent.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: You're beautiful.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Oh, I have to hear this.

turns.speaker: COURTNEY
turns.text: In my heart, Heather's still alive.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: What are you talking about? She hated you! You hated her!  What are you smiling at?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: I don't know. This thing leaves a bad taste in my mouth.

turns.speaker: COURTNEY
turns.text: Like last night, Veronica?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: I'm sorry? I don't get it.

turns.speaker: COURTNEY
turns.text: You did last night.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Take a break Veronica, sit down.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: All right.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: So what was the first week of Spring Vacation withdrawl like?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: I don't know, it was okay, I guess.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Goddamn. Will somebody please tell me why I read this spy crap.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Because you're an idiot.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Oh yeah, that's it.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: All right.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: So what was the first day after Heather's suicide like?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: I don't know, it was okay, I guess.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Goddamn. Will somebody please tell me why I smoke these damn things?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Because you're an idiot.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Oh yeah, that's it.

turns.speaker: DAD
turns.text: Hey Veronica, how'd that Teenage Prevention T.V. Suicide thing go?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Color me educated. I learned high school happiness is for members only, Pauline Fleming wouldn't know reality if it lived in her uterus, and reality's name's Heather James. Also, J.D.'s a major creep.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Let me get it clear, Veronica. You want yourself a sweet homeboy for this T.V. show so you can show everybody what a loose, Martin Luther Cosby-lovng place Westerburg is.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Something like that. Will you do it?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Damn, you're a shrewd one. Shrewd.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: I just want to show different kinds of people can get together and it doesn't have to be Vietnam. You don't get treated badly here do you?

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: I don't get treated at all, but hey, don't worry about it. I'll do your thing. It'll give my Mom a smile.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Things are going to change, Earl.

turns.speaker: EARL
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: Veronica. Finally. Got a paper of Kurt Kelly's. I need you to forge a hot and horny but realistically low-key note in Kurt's handwriting and we'll slip it into Martha Dumptruck's lunch tray.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Shit, Heather. I don't have anything against Martha Dunnstock.

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: You don't have anything <u>for</u> her either. Come on, it'll be Very. The note'll give her shower nozzle masturbation material for weeks.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: I'll think about it.

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: Don't think.

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: Sawyer. Guess what today is?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Ouch....the lunchtime poll. So what's the question?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Hey, this question wouldn't be that bizarro thing you were babbling about over the phone last......

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: Shut up, it is. I told Dennis if he gave me another topic that was political, I'd spew burrito chunks.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: I was talking with someone!

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: Color me impressed. I thought you grew out of Betty Finn.

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: If you're going to openly be a bitch....

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: I'm sorry, it's just why can't we talk to different kinds of people?

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: Fuck me gently with a chainsaw. Do I look like Mother Theresa? If I did, I probably wouldn't mind talking to the Geek Squad.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Doesn't it bother you that everyone in the school thinks you're a pirahna?

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: Like I give a shit. They all want me, as a friend or a fuck. I'm worshipped at Westerburg and I'm only a Junior.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Pretend you're a missionary saving a colony of cootie victims.

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: Whatever. I don't believe this. We're going to a party at Remington University tonight and we're brushing up our conversation skills with the scum of the school.

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: Just imagine somebody like your quasi-fat, goody-good friend Betty Finn doing a Crest commercial. No one would buy Crest.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Don't tell me. Crest would be stained with loserness.

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: Yeah, and who wants that on their teeth?

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: You wanted to become a member of the most powerful clique in the school. If I wasn't already the head of it, I'd want the same thing.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: I'm sorry? What are you oozing about?

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: That episode with the note back there was for all of us to enjoy, but you're determined to ruin my day.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: We made a girl want to consider suicide. What a scream. What a jest.

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: Come on you jerk. You know you used to have a sense of humor.

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: Come on Heather. We want another look at today's lunch.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Geez, don't listen to them.

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: J.D.? You seem pretty amused. I thought you were giving up on high school guys.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Never say never.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Crap. So who's this Brad guy I've been set up with? Witty and urbane pre-lawyer or albino accountant?

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: Don't worry. David says he's very so he's very.

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: What's your damage? Brad says you're being a real cooze.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Heather, I feel awful, like I'm going to throw up. Can we jam, please?

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: No. Hell no.

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: You stupid cunt!

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: You goddamn bitch!

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: You were nothing before you met me! You were playing Barbies with Betty Finn! You were a Brownie, you were a Bluebird, you were a Girl Scout Cookie! I got you into a Remington Party! What's my thanks? It's on the hallway carpet. I get paid in puke!

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Lick it up, baby. Lick. It. Up.

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: Monday morning, you're history. I'll tell everyone about tonight. Transfer to Washington. Transfer to Jefferson. No one at Westerburg's going to let you play their reindeer games.

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: Veronica. And Jesse James. Quelle surprise. Hear about Veronica's affection for regurgitation?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: We both said a lot of things we didn't mean, last night.

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: Did we? How the hell'd you get in here?

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: Is this turnout weak or what? I had <u>at least</u> seventy more people at my funeral.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Heather? Wha...

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: Oh God Veronica, my afterlife is s-o-o boring. If I have to sing "Kumbaya" one more time...

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: What are you doing here?!

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: I made your favorite. Spaghetti. Lots of oregano.

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: Ku-urt, let's pa-arty.

turns.speaker: HEATHER MCNAMARA
turns.text: Ku-urt, I ne-ed an orgasm.

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: Grow up, Heather. Bulimia's so '86.

turns.speaker: HEATHER MCNAMARA
turns.text: Color me nauseous.

turns.speaker: HEATHER MCNAMARA
turns.text: God, they won't expell him. They'll just suspend him for a week or something.

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: He used a real gun. They should throw his ass in jail.

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: Anyway, I can say never to high school. I've got David.

turns.speaker: HEATHER MCNAMARA
turns.text: King David.

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: Maybe when you hit maturity you'll understand the diff between a Remington University man like David and a Westerburg boy like Ram "Wham-bam- thank-you-maam" Sweeney.

turns.speaker: HEATHER MCNAMARA
turns.text: So tonight's the night. Are you two excited?

turns.speaker: HEATHER CHANDLER
turns.text: I'm giving Veronica her shot. Her first Remington Party. Blow it tonight girl and it's keggers with kids all next year.

turns.speaker: HEATHER DUKE
turns.text: Where did you get these?

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: Oh, I just had the <u>nicest</u> chat with Ms. Dumptruck. Got along famously! It's scary how everyone's got a story to tell....Would you care to see the canoeing shots?

turns.speaker: HEATHER DUKE
turns.text: What do you want from me?

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: Strength. Westerburg doesn't need mushy togetherness, it needs a leader. Heather Chandler was that leader but...

turns.speaker: HEATHER DUKE
turns.text: But she couldn't handle it.

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: I think you can. In Catcher in the Rye Holden says his ideal job'd be making sure some kids don't fall off a cliff. He doesn't realize if you pay too much attention to the kids, you'll back off the cliff yourself.

turns.speaker: HEATHER DUKE
turns.text: Very very. The photographs?

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: Don't worry. I'll ask you to do me a favor. You'll get the negatives and everything back then.

turns.speaker: HEATHER DUKE
turns.text: TEENAGE SUICIDE; DON'T DO IT!

turns.speaker: J.D.
turns.text: Some teenybopper rag says Big Fun wants to play a Prom. It could be Westerburg's if we can get everyone's John Hancock.

turns.speaker: HEATHER DUKE
turns.text: Yeah, she really wants to talk to you.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Okay, I'm going, I'm going. Jesus...

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Maybe you should see a doctor.

turns.speaker: HEATHER DUKE
turns.text: Yeah, maybe.

turns.speaker: HEATHER DUKE
turns.text: Yeah, you know Holden Caulfield in the Catcher in the Rye wouldn't put up with their bogus nonsense.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Well, you better move Holden out of the way or he's going to get spewed.

turns.speaker: HEATHER DUKE
turns.text: Don't worry. We'll work something out.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Yes. Yes. We'll work something out. I swear to God. Won't we J.D.?...J.D.?

turns.speaker: HEATHER DUKE
turns.text: Guess who?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Heather.

turns.speaker: HEATHER DUKE
turns.text: Hi everyone, door was open. Veronica, you missed it! Pauline and Whitney James were up there doing there suicide rap when the cops come in and announce that Martha Dumptruck tried to buy the farm. She gave the ticket girl at the Colfax theatre a suicide note then bellyflopped in front of a car.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Is she dead?

turns.speaker: HEATHER DUKE
turns.text: That's the punchline. She's still alive, in stable condition. Another case of a geek trying to imitate the popular people of the school and failing miserably. Is that pate?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: I said I was sorry.

turns.speaker: HEATHER DUKE
turns.text: You are out of control. Heather and Kurt were a shock, but Martha Dumptruck, get crucial! She dialed suicide hotlines in her diapers.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: You're not funny. Ouch!

turns.speaker: HEATHER DUKE
turns.text: What. A. Martyr. Understand; Martha couldn't take the heat so she got out of the kitchen. Just think what a better place the world would be if every nimrod followed her cue.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Just shut up and turn on the radio. Hot Probs is on.

turns.speaker: HEATHER DUKE
turns.text: Oh shit, yeah.

turns.speaker: HEATHER DUKE
turns.text: Veronica! Color me stoked, girl. I've gotten <u>everyone</u> to sign this petition even the one who think BigFun are tuneless Eurofags. People love me!  My God, you haven't signed!

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: People love you but I know you. Jennifer Forbes told me the petition she signed was to put a jacuzzi in the cafeteria. And Doug Hylton...

turns.speaker: HEATHER DUKE
turns.text: So some people need different kinds of "convincing" than others....  Hey, just sign the petition!

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Don't talk to me like that.

turns.speaker: HEATHER DUKE
turns.text: It was J.D.'s idea! He made out the signature sheet and everything. Now will you sign it?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: HEATHER DUKE
turns.text: Jealous much?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Heather, why can't you just be a friend? Why are you such a MegaBitch?

turns.speaker: HEATHER DUKE
turns.text: Because I can be! The same fucking cheek, goddamnit! Why are you pulling my dick? Do you think, do you really think, if Betty Finn's fairy godmother made <u>her</u> Cool, she'd still act nice and hang with her dweebette friends? No way! Uh-Uh!

turns.speaker: HEATHER DUKE
turns.text: Veronica, you look like hell.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Yeah, I just got back.

turns.speaker: HEATHER DUKE
turns.text: What are you doing?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Heather, my love, there's a new sheriff in town.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: What's your damage, Heather? You ruined my...

turns.speaker: HEATHER MCNAMARA
turns.text: God, I'm so sure. Don't blame me, blame Heather. She told me to haul your ass into the caf pronto. Back me up, Heather.

turns.speaker: HEATHER MCNAMARA
turns.text: God, aren't they fed yet? Do they even have Thanksgiving in Africa?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Oh sure, Pilgrims, Indians, tater tots; it's a real party continent.

turns.speaker: HEATHER MCNAMARA
turns.text: God Veronica, drool much? His name's Jason Dean. He's in my American History.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Give me the clipboard.

turns.speaker: HEATHER MCNAMARA
turns.text: No way, no day!

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Give it up girl!

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Watch it, Heather. You could actually be digesting food.

turns.speaker: HEATHER MCNAMARA
turns.text: Yeah, where's your urge to purge?

turns.speaker: HEATHER MCNAMARA
turns.text: That was seriously warped, Veronica.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Uh-huh.

turns.speaker: HEATHER MCNAMARA
turns.text: Veronica. What are you doing tonight?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Mourning. Maybe watch some T.V. Why?

turns.speaker: HEATHER MCNAMARA
turns.text: Ram asked me out, but he wants to double with Kurt and Kurt doesn't have a date.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: Hea<u>ther</u>, I've got something going with J.D.

turns.speaker: HEATHER MCNAMARA
turns.text: Please Veronica. Put Billy the Kid on hold tonight, I'll never forget it.

turns.speaker: HEATHER MCNAMARA
turns.text: Shit.

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: So did you call people to tell them how to get to the studio tonight?

turns.speaker: VERONICA
turns.text: What were <u>you</u> trying to do? Sleep?

turns.speaker: HEATHER MCNAMARA
turns.text: Suicide is a private thing.
